name: Thread-like Naiad

Identifying Characteristics: Leaves: very slender thread-like (1-4cm long, 0.2mm wide), finely serrated, arrangement is mixed: opposite, whorls, clumped at tips
Flowers: midsummer, tiny inconspicuous, develop in leaf axils
Fruits/Seeds: 3mm long, cylindrical, pointed at both ends, straight, shallow pits in rows (with magnification) longer than wide
Biology: Vegetative reproduction may occur during growing season
Range: Native Range: Maine, New England, eastern, central-eastern United States and California

tags: plants with blade-shaped leaves on stems
fine slender leaves - not arranged in whorls
